title: Elinchen_project
text:
1 Topic
Comparing LIME with Intrinsically Interpretable Models


2 Research Question:
Do LIME’s explanations about black box models align with the interpretability of intrinsically interpretable models like linear regression?


3 Key elements to examine:

Do the most important features identified by LIME match those from linear regression?
How consistent are LIME’s explanations across similar observations?
When they disagree, what patterns emerge?

title: 2  Data
text:
3
Code
coefficients_df <- as.data.frame(summary(lm_model)$coefficients)
coefficients_df$Feature <- rownames(coefficients_df)
coefficients_df <- coefficients_df[-1, ]  # Remove intercept
coefficients_df$AbsEstimate <- abs(coefficients_df$Estimate)
coefficients_df <- coefficients_df[order(-coefficients_df$AbsEstimate), ]

head(coefficients_df, 5)
